Until recently, both the tracker and the available data set showed case and death rates by at up to four specific vaccination statuses, which included: unvaccinated; vaccinated with primary series only; vaccinated with booster; and vaccinated with 2nd booster. For obvious reasons, the last two categories were available only at later dates. As you can see, this data broke down the incidence of infection and death in the vaccinated category in up to 3 different categories, allowing the ability to assess the differences in effectiveness of different vaccination strategies. This data was also presented by MMWR week, and by age group and vaccine manufacturer, allowing comparisons of these different groups. With the roll out of the new bivalent booster, the data tracker, as well as the underlying downloadable dataset, have been changed. Now, all groups that have received any vaccine, but not the bivalent booster, are lumped together in one category. This makes it impossible to separately compare those who have received the bivalent booster to those who received only the primary vaccine, or one or two boosters on top of the primary regimen. These are important data for individuals to be aware of in making their personal decisions about the relative benefit of the bivalent booster for them. It is not clear to me why this change has been made in the data tracker, or the available data set. I am formally submitting this request under the Freedom of Information Act, then, to request the data regarding the number of infections and deaths, as well as population numbers, of the individual groups, as so: unvaccinated; vaccinated with primary series only; vaccinated with primary series and one booster; vaccinated with primary series and two boosters; vaccinated with any number of primary-series vaccines and bivalent booster. This data should be broken down by MMWR week, age group, and vaccine manufacturer. I will note that this request is for precisely the information that was formerly available for download from the CDC site, except now to include the same data for those who have also received the bivalent booster.
